    About Me

    Hi, I am Aishwarya Gupta, first year PhD scholar at the University of Utah. Before joining the PhD program, I have worked as a Research Engineer in Computer Vision and Media Analytics Team for two years at Conduent Labs India(previously known as Xerox Research Center India). While working at Conduent Labs India, I got an opportunity to work on some of the real world challenges (especially in the transport sector) and have contributed to the following projects: Vehicle Passenger Detection System, Remaining Utility Life(a research thread of the project Vehicle Health Monitoring) and Vehicle Re-Identification.

    I have completed M.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Kanpur, India where I worked on learning probabilistic models for multi-label learning problem via graph embeddings. I also worked on leveraging the label co-occurrence matrix for learning the probabilistic model for zero-shot multi-label learning problem.
